QMR.H

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 //*****************************************************************
00002 // Iterative template routine -- QMR
00003 //
00004 // QMR.h solves the unsymmetric linear system Ax = b using the
00005 // Quasi-Minimal Residual method following the algorithm as described
00006 // on p. 24 in the SIAM Templates book.
00007 //
00008 //   -------------------------------------------------------------
00009 //   return value     indicates
00010 //   ------------     ---------------------
00011 //        0           convergence within max_iter iterations
00012 //        1           no convergence after max_iter iterations
00013 //                    breakdown in:
00014 //        2             rho
00015 //        3             beta
00016 //        4             gamma
00017 //        5             delta
00018 //        6             ep
00019 //        7             xi
00020 //   -------------------------------------------------------------
00021 //   
00022 // Upon successful return, output arguments have the following values:
00023 //
00024 //        x  --  approximate solution to Ax=b
00025 // max_iter  --  the number of iterations performed before the
00026 //               tolerance was reached
00027 //      tol  --  the residual after the final iteration
00028 //
00029 //*****************************************************************
00030 
00031 
00032 #include <math.h>
00033 
00034 template < class Matrix, class Vector, class Preconditioner1,
00035            class Preconditioner2, class Real >
00036 int 
00037 QMR(const Matrix &A, Vector &x, const Vector &b, const Preconditioner1 &M1, 
00038     const Preconditioner2 &M2, int &max_iter, Real &tol)
00039 {
00040   Real resid;
00041 
00042   Vector rho(1), rho_1(1), xi(1), gamma(1), gamma_1(1), theta(1), theta_1(1);
00043   Vector eta(1), delta(1), ep(1), beta(1);
00044 
00045   Vector r, v_tld, y, w_tld, z;
00046   Vector v, w, y_tld, z_tld;
00047   Vector p, q, p_tld, d, s;
00048 
00049   Real normb = norm(b);
00050 
00051   r = b - A * x;
00052 
00053   if (normb == 0.0)
00054     normb = 1;
00055 
00056   if ((resid = norm(r) / normb) <= tol) {
00057     tol = resid;
00058     max_iter = 0;
00059     return 0;
00060   }
00061 
00062   v_tld = r;
00063   y = M1.solve(v_tld);
00064   rho(0) = norm(y);
00065 
00066   w_tld = r;
00067   z = M2.trans_solve(w_tld);
00068   xi(0) = norm(z);
00069 
00070   gamma(0) = 1.0;
00071   eta(0) = -1.0;
00072   theta(0) = 0.0;
00073 
00074   for (int i = 1; i <= max_iter; i++) {
00075 
00076     if (rho(0) == 0.0)
00077       return 2;                        // return on breakdown
00078 
00079     if (xi(0) == 0.0)
00080       return 7;                        // return on breakdown
00081 
00082     v = (1. / rho(0)) * v_tld;
00083     y = (1. / rho(0)) * y;
00084 
00085     w = (1. / xi(0)) * w_tld;
00086     z = (1. / xi(0)) * z;
00087 
00088     delta(0) = dot(z, y);
00089     if (delta(0) == 0.0)
00090       return 5;                        // return on breakdown
00091 
00092     y_tld = M2.solve(y);               // apply preconditioners
00093     z_tld = M1.trans_solve(z);
00094 
00095     if (i > 1) {
00096       p = y_tld - (xi(0) * delta(0) / ep(0)) * p;
00097       q = z_tld - (rho(0) * delta(0) / ep(0)) * q;
00098     } else {
00099       p = y_tld;
00100       q = z_tld;
00101     }
00102 
00103     p_tld = A * p;
00104     ep(0) = dot(q, p_tld);
00105     if (ep(0) == 0.0)
00106       return 6;                        // return on breakdown
00107 
00108     beta(0) = ep(0) / delta(0);
00109     if (beta(0) == 0.0)
00110       return 3;                        // return on breakdown
00111 
00112     v_tld = p_tld - beta(0) * v;
00113     y = M1.solve(v_tld);
00114 
00115     rho_1(0) = rho(0);
00116     rho(0) = norm(y);
00117     w_tld = A.trans_mult(q) - beta(0) * w;
00118     z = M2.trans_solve(w_tld);
00119 
00120     xi(0) = norm(z);
00121 
00122     gamma_1(0) = gamma(0);
00123     theta_1(0) = theta(0);
00124 
00125     theta(0) = rho(0) / (gamma_1(0) * beta(0));
00126     gamma(0) = 1.0 / sqrt(1.0 + theta(0) * theta(0));
00127 
00128     if (gamma(0) == 0.0)
00129       return 4;                        // return on breakdown
00130 
00131     eta(0) = -eta(0) * rho_1(0) * gamma(0) * gamma(0) / 
00132       (beta(0) * gamma_1(0) * gamma_1(0));
00133 
00134     if (i > 1) {
00135       d = eta(0) * p + (theta_1(0) * theta_1(0) * gamma(0) * gamma(0)) * d;
00136       s = eta(0) * p_tld + (theta_1(0) * theta_1(0) * gamma(0) * gamma(0)) * s;
00137     } else {
00138       d = eta(0) * p;
00139       s = eta(0) * p_tld;
00140     }
00141 
00142     x += d;                            // update approximation vector
00143     r -= s;                            // compute residual
00144 
00145     if ((resid = norm(r) / normb) <= tol) {
00146       tol = resid;
00147       max_iter = i;
00148       return 0;
00149     }
00150   }
00151 
00152   tol = resid;
00153   return 1;                            // no convergence
00154 }
